Help.Text: The BITAND() function performs a bit-wise AND operation for the two integer parameters. Note that this function is currently restricted to operation on values of 2^31 or less, which is non-confomant to the OpenFormula specification.
Help.Example: BITAND(12;10) returns 8 (because decimal 12 is binary 1100, and decimal 10 is binary 0100; and 1100 "anded" with 0110 is 0100, which is integer 8).

Help.Text: The BITOR() function performs a bit-wise OR operation for the two integer parameters. Note that this function is currently restricted to operation on values of 2^31 or less, which is non-confomant to the OpenFormula specification.
Help.Example: BITOR(12;10) returns 14 (because decimal 12 is binary 1100, and decimal 10 is binary 0100; and 1100 "ored" with 0110 is 1110, which is integer 14).
